question: Asan Conservation Reserve has recently become the first Ramsar site of which state?
explanation:
Asan Conservation Reserve has become the first Ramsar site in the state of Uttarakhand, as per the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change.
This site which was made the ‘Wetland of International Importance’, is located on the banks of Yamuna river near Dehradun district. With this, the number of Ramsar sites in India goes up to 38.
